G4271-d-01-04-98-WC.Narrative: THE 1530 W. SWITCH CREW WAS PERFORMING SWITCHING DUTIES IN THE FOND DU LAC YARD ON TRACK 69.  THEY HAD A HOLD OF 3 LOADS AND 44 EMPTIES WHEN THEY HAD STRETCHED THE TRACK AND STARTED TO SHOVE.  THE TRAIN HAD GONE APPROX. 7 CAR LENGTHS WHEN IT STOPPED.  THE CREW WALKED BACK AND FOUND A TOTAL OF 5 CARSDERAILED, 4 FROM THEIR TRAIN & 1 CAR THAT WAS STANDING ON AN ADJACENT TRACK.  AN INSPECTION OF THETRACK AND EQUIPMENT FOUND NO DEFECTS.  INTERVIEWS WITH THE CREW  MEMBERS, ALONG WITH THE DOWNLOAD OFLOCOMOTIVES, FOUND NO EXCEPTIONS WITH THE CREW OR TRAIN.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT BY THE TRANSPORTATION, MECHANICAL AND ENGINEERING DEPARTMENTS HAS DETERMINED THAT THE CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENTWAS DUE TO LATERAL/VERTICAL FORCES.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

98012-d-01-31-98-ARR.Accident Cause: Other extreme environmental conditions (Provide detailed description in narrative)
98012-d-01-31-98-ARR.Narrative: TRAIN WAS PROCEEDING SOUTHWARD WITH 666 LOADS OF COAL AND AT SPENCER SET OUT THE REAR 33 LOADS AS PART OF A PLANNED MANEUVER TO DOUBLE THE GRANDVIEW HILL,  AFTER PLACING A TWO WAY TELEMETRY DEVICE ONTHE LAST CAR OF THE FIRST CUT, THE TRAIN PROCEEDED SOUTHWARD.  AS THE TRAIN WAS APPROACHING TUNNEL SECTION HOUSE, THE ENGINEERWAS OPERATING THE SIX UNIT IN THE 6TH THROTTLE POSITION TO MAINTAIN A SPEED OF 15 MPH.  WHEN THE TRAIN BEGAN TO NEGOTIATE THE 3% ASCENDING GRADE SOUTH OF MP 51, THE LEAD UNITBEGAN TO INTERMITTENTLY DROP ITS LOAD.  THE TRAIN SPEED DECREASED TO ABOUT ONE MPH AND THE ENGINEERMADE A BRAKE APPLICATION TO HOLD THE TRAIN ON THE GRADE.  THE ENGINEER THEN MADE A REVERSE MOVEMENTTO ASSURE THAT THE BRAKES WOULD HOLD THE TRAIN.  AT THIS TIME, THE ENGINEER DETERMINED THAT HE MAYNOT ABLE TO CONTROL THE TRAIN SPEED IN REVERSE MOVEMENT FROM THE POINT WHERE THE TRAIN STALLED.  ITWAS THEN DECIDED TO ALLOW THE EXCESS TONNAGE, THE CARS, TO STAND BETWEEN MP 49.8 AND MP 49.6.  THE BRAKEMAN THEN WALKED BACK AND AFTER SETTING THE HANDBRAKE ON  THE SOUTH SIX CARS OF THE CUT TO BE LEFT,UNCOUPLED THE CARS, AND RODE ON THE SOUTH CAR OF A 17 CAR CUT WHILE THE TRAIN PROCEEDED TO GRANDVIEW.  AFTER ARRIVING AT GRANDVIEW, THE TRAIN CREW WAS ADVISED BY THE AVALANCHE CONTROL TECHNICIAN THAT IT WOULD POSE TOO GREAT OF RISK TO RETURN FOR THE CARS THAT HAD BEEN LEFT NEAR MP. 49.6.  LATER, IT WAS FOUND THE 3 CARS HAD BEEN DERAILED OFF THE TRACK BY A SNOW AVALANCHE.
